title: How to Make a Raw Cookie Sandwich

steps.headline: Place the Brazil nuts and the pumpkin seeds into a food processor and chop them until they resemble coarse crumbs.
Add the cocoa powder, stevia, water, vanilla extract and salt to the mix.
Process the batter until it comes together easily without being wet.
Dump the cookie dough onto a work surface and shape it into a disc.
Wrap the disc in plastic wrap and chill it for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
Place the chilled dough on your work surface and roll it out with a rolling pin until the dough is about 1/4” (6 mm) thick.
Press a cookie cutter into the dough and cut out your sandwich shapes.
steps.description: You want to cut out approximately 12 raw cookie dough shapes. If you need additional cookies, then roll out your scrap dough again to a 1/4” (6 mm) thickness and cut out more cookies.

steps.headline: Place the cookies onto a baking sheet that has been covered with parchment paper.
Cover the baking sheet with plastic wrap and chill it until you are ready to assemble the cookies.
Place the banana, raspberries and coconut oil into a blender and puree the mixture until it is creamy.
Spread the filling onto a clean baking sheet that has been covered in parchment paper, using an offset spatula.
steps.description: You want the filling to be about 1/4” (6 mm) thick and as even as possible.

steps.headline: Cover the filling with plastic wrap and place it in the freezer until it has set.
Remove the cookie dough from the refrigerator and remove the filling from the freezer.
Using the same cookie cutter that you used for the dough, cut 6 shapes from the frozen filling.
Place the 6 filling shapes onto 6 of the raw cookies.
Top the cookies with an additional 6 raw cookies to create your raw cookie sandwiches.

text: Preparing the Cookie Dough Place the Brazil nuts and the pumpkin seeds into a food processor and chop them until they resemble coarse crumbs.  Add the cocoa powder, stevia, water, vanilla extract and salt to the mix.  Process the batter until it comes together easily without being wet.  Dump the cookie dough onto a work surface and shape it into a disc.  Wrap the disc in plastic wrap and chill it for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.  Cutting the Cookies Place the chilled dough on your work surface and roll it out with a rolling pin until the dough is about 1/4” (6 mm) thick.  Press a cookie cutter into the dough and cut out your sandwich shapes. You want to cut out approximately 12 raw cookie dough shapes. If you need additional cookies, then roll out your scrap dough again to a 1/4” (6 mm) thickness and cut out more cookies. Place the cookies onto a baking sheet that has been covered with parchment paper.  Cover the baking sheet with plastic wrap and chill it until you are ready to assemble the cookies.  Preparing the Filling Place the banana, raspberries and coconut oil into a blender and puree the mixture until it is creamy.  Spread the filling onto a clean baking sheet that has been covered in parchment paper, using an offset spatula. You want the filling to be about 1/4” (6 mm) thick and as even as possible. Cover the filling with plastic wrap and place it in the freezer until it has set.  Assembling the Cookies Remove the cookie dough from the refrigerator and remove the filling from the freezer.  Using the same cookie cutter that you used for the dough, cut 6 shapes from the frozen filling.  Place the 6 filling shapes onto 6 of the raw cookies.  Top the cookies with an additional 6 raw cookies to create your raw cookie sandwiches.
